Package towersim.display

Class ViewModel

  • Object

  • public class ViewModel
extends Object
    View model for the Control Tower Simulation GUI.
    Implement this for assignment 2

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewModel

        public ViewModel​(List<String> filenames)
          throws IOException,
                 MalformedSaveException
        Creates a new view model and constructs a control tower by reading from the given filenames.
        Parameters:
        filenames - list of four filenames, specifying the paths to: (1) the tick file; (2) the aircraft file; (3) the queues file; (4) the terminals/gates file
        Throws:
        IOException - if loading from the files specifies generates an IOException
        MalformedSaveException - if any of the files are invalid according to ControlTowerInitialiser.createControlTower(Reader, Reader, Reader, Reader)
        Requires:
        filenames != null && filenames.size() == 4
        Given for assignment 2

    • Method Detail

      • getDroneAlertHandler

        public EventHandler<ActionEvent> getDroneAlertHandler()
        Returns an event handler for when the "Drone Alert" button is clicked.

        This event handler should declare a state of emergency on all terminals managed by the control tower. Finally, it should call registerChange() to update the GUI.

        Returns:
        event handler for "Drone Alert" button
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • getDroneClearHandler

        public EventHandler<ActionEvent> getDroneClearHandler()
        Returns an event handler for when the "Clear Drone Alert" button is clicked.

        This event handler should clear the state of emergency on all terminals managed by control tower. Finally, it should all registerChange() to update the GUI.

        Returns:
        event handler for "Clear Drone Alert" button
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • getFindSuitableGateHandler

        public EventHandler<ActionEvent> getFindSuitableGateHandler()
        Returns an event handler for when the "Find Gate for Selected Aircraft" button is clicked.

        The overall purpose of this event handler is to update the suitableGateText string property with the gate found for the currently selected aircraft, as returned by ControlTower.findUnoccupiedGate(Aircraft).

        The event handler should perform the following actions:

        1. If no aircraft is currently selected (i.e. getSelectedAircraft() is storing null), then the event handler should return immediately without taking any further action.
        2. If the currently selected aircraft's current task type is not LAND, then the event handler should return immediately without taking any further action.
        3. If calling ControlTower.findUnoccupiedGate(Aircraft) for the currently selected aircraft throws a NoSuitableGateException, then the suitableGateText property should be set to "NoSuitableGateException".
        4. Otherwise, the suitableGateText property should be set to the toString() representation of the gate found by findUnoccupiedGate().
        Returns:
        event handler for "Find Gate for Selected Aircraft" button
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • saveAs

        public void saveAs​(Writer tickWriter,
                   Writer aircraftWriter,
                   Writer queuesWriter,
                   Writer terminalsWithGatesWriter)
            throws IOException
        Saves the current state of the control tower simulation to the given writers.

        Each writer should be written to in the following format:

        Writer output format
        WriterFormat
        tickWriter
        ticksElapsed
        where ticksElapsed is the number of ticks elapsed, as returned by ControlTower.getTicksElapsed()
        aircraftWriter
        numAircraft
encodedAircraft1
encodedAircraft2
...
encodedAircraftN
        where
        • numAircraft is the number of aircraft managed by the control tower
        • encodedAircraftX is the encoded representation of the Xth aircraft managed by the control tower, in the same order as returned by ControlTower.getAircraft(), with X from 1 to N inclusive, where N is the total number of aircraft
        queuesWriter
        encodedTakeoffQueue
encodedLandingQueue
LoadingAircraft:numLoadingAircraft
callsign1:ticksRemaining1,callsign2:ticksRemaining2,...,callsignN:ticksRemainingN
        where
        • encodedTakeoffQueue is the encoded representation of the control tower's takeoff queue
        • encodedLandingQueue is the encoded representation of the control tower's landing queue
        • numLoadingAircraft is the number of aircraft currently loading at a gate
        • callsignX is the callsign of the Xth aircraft that is loading at a gate, in the same order as returned by ControlTower.getLoadingAircraft(), with X from 1 to N inclusive, where N is the number of aircraft currently loading
        • ticksRemainingX is the number of ticks remaining in the loading process of the Xth aircraft that is loading at a gate, in the same order as returned by ControlTower.getLoadingAircraft(), with X from 1 to N inclusive, where N is the number of aircraft currently loading
        terminalsWithGatesWriter
        numTerminals
encodedTerminalWithGates1
encodedTerminalWithGates2
...
encodedTerminalWithGatesN
        where
        • numTerminals is the number of terminals managed by the control tower
        • encodedTerminalWithGatesX is the encoded representation of the Xth terminal (including its gates) in the same order as returned by ControlTower.getTerminals(), with X between 1 and N inclusive, where N is the number of terminals.
        Parameters:
        tickWriter - writer to which the number of ticks elapsed will be written
        aircraftWriter - writer to which the list of aircraft will be written
        queuesWriter - writer to which the takeoff/landing queues and loading map will be written
        terminalsWithGatesWriter - writer to which the list of terminals and their gates will be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IOException occurs when writing to the writers
        Implement this for assignment 2
